definitions.text: a light sharp contact (usually with something flexible)
examples: he gave it a flick with his finger
he felt the flick of a whip

definitions.text: a form of entertainment that enacts a story by sound and a sequence of images giving the illusion of continuous movement
examples: they went to a movie every Saturday night
the film was shot on location
The lights flicked on and off

definitions.text: look through a book or other written material
cause to move with a flick
throw or toss with a quick motion
examples: flick a piece of paper across the table

definitions.text: cause to make a snapping sound
touch or hit with a light, quick blow
remove with a flick (of the hand)
